title: Major demon
data:
**Major demons** are a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. These "true" demons are defined by the `M2_DEMON` flag, which is in turn used by other code such as the `is_demon` function.

## List of demons

The following monsters are considered demons:

### Lawful demons

- & [horned devil](/wiki/Horned_devil "Horned devil")
- & [erinys](/wiki/Erinys "Erinys")
- & [barbed devil](/wiki/Barbed_devil "Barbed devil")
- & [Geryon](/wiki/Geryon "Geryon")
- & [Dispater](/wiki/Dispater "Dispater")
- & [Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub "Baalzebub")
- & [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus")

### Chaotic demons

- & [water demon](/wiki/Water_demon "Water demon")
- & [succubus](/wiki/Succubus "Succubus")
- & [incubus](/wiki/Incubus "Incubus")
- & [marilith](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith")
- & [vrock](/wiki/Vrock "Vrock")
- & [hezrou](/wiki/Hezrou "Hezrou")
- & [bone devil](/wiki/Bone_devil "Bone devil")
- & [ice devil](/wiki/Ice_devil "Ice devil")
- & [nalfeshnee](/wiki/Nalfeshnee "Nalfeshnee")
- & [pit fiend](/wiki/Pit_fiend "Pit fiend")
- & [balrog](/wiki/Balrog "Balrog")
- & [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex")
- & [Yeenoghu](/wiki/Yeenoghu "Yeenoghu")
- & [Orcus](/wiki/Orcus "Orcus")
- & [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon")

## Common traits

All demons are part of the [demon](/wiki/Demon_\(monster_class\) "Demon (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class").

Demons and devils possess [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), and [death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance") (although they are still considered living creatures). They are vulnerable to [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver"), and take an extra d20 damage when struck with a silver weapon. They also take an extra d4 damage from [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") weapons or bare-handed or martial attacks with [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") gloves. Non-[unique](/wiki/Unique "Unique") demons and devils cannot be tamed unless the [player](/wiki/Player "Player") character is one as well.

[Demon lords and princes](/wiki/Demon_lords_and_princes "Demon lords and princes") are powerful unique monsters that inhabit Gehennom - a character will encounter some of their lairs while traversing Gehennom, and some others can only be encountered if they are summoned.

### Generation

Major demons are always generated hostile, and are mostly found in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") with the exception of [quest nemeses](/wiki/Quest_nemeses "Quest nemeses"), though they can be summoned in the main dungeon through the various means described below:

- [Summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") can generate demons among the various hostile monsters that appear.
- [Polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") can create demons and other out of depth monsters, as can the [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") and [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph") if you use them on other monsters.
- Demons [can be summoned](#Demon_summoning) as the [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") of [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch") or a [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") god.
- Demons generated by any of the above methods can also [gate in other demons](#Demons_summoning_demons) with their melee attacks, with the exception of foocubi and balrogs.

Non-unique major demons that are generated at level creation have a 4⁄5 chance of being created asleep unless you possess the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), in which case they will always be awake.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

### Demon summoning

Hostile demons are generated if you anger Moloch or a chaotic deity, e.g. by converting or destroying their altars, or else by praying to a chaotic god with negative alignment.

[Sacrificing your own race](/wiki/Sacrifice#Sacrificing_creatures_of_own_race "Sacrifice") can summon a major demon or a demon lord (but not a demon prince), as can [angering](/wiki/Anger "Anger") a chaotic god when on an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") (by [praying](/wiki/Pray "Pray") with negative alignment, converting a chaotic altar, or a few other actions).

### Demons summoning demons

Major demons, demon lords and demon princes have a 1⁄13 chance of summoning or "gating in" another demon each time that demon acts when adjacent to you (or your displaced image, in the case of [displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement"))[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) - major demons can summon other major demons and demon lords, while demon lords and princes can summon other demon rulers alongside major demons. Demon quest nemeses can summon other major demons, but cannot be summoned this way; foocubi and balrogs cannot summon demons, but can be gated in by other demons.

Demon gating will always generate co-aligned demons, e.g. mariliths can gate in other chaotic demons and demon lords - as there are no lawful demon lords, lawful major demons will only summon other major demons, because there are no lawful demon lords. The [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") summoning nasties is an exception, as is any use of the spell in Gehennom (which is treated as though the Wizard cast it), and can create demons of any alignment.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

The difference between major demons, demon lords, and demon princes lies in which other demons they can summon, and how often: all demons can summon other major demons, and are capable of summoning stronger demons as well. Major demons and demon lords have a 1⁄20 chance of summoning a co-aligned demon lord, while demon lords have a 1⁄20 chance of summoning another co-aligned demon lord, and a 1⁄50 chance of summoning a demon prince. Demon princes and the Wizard of Yendor have a 1⁄20 chance of summoning a co-aligned demon prince, and a 1⁄4 chance of summoning a co-aligned demon lord if a prince is not summoned. Major demons that summon other major demons will choose their own type 5⁄6 of the time, and otherwise choose a random type.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Demon lords and princes that summon a major demon have a 1⁄4 chance of summoning two demons of that type.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) [Demonbane](/wiki/Demonbane "Demonbane") completely blocks all forms of demon gating while wielded.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

The following table shows the chance of a given demon gating in another demon of a specific rank:

| Summoner                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | Summoned demon |            |              |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------- | ---------- | ------------ |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | Major demon    | Demon lord | Demon prince |
| **Major demons** (except [foocubi](/wiki/Foocubus "Foocubus") and [balrogs](/wiki/Balrog "Balrog"))                                                                                                                                                  | 95%            | 5%         | 0%           |
| **Demon lords** [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex"), [Yeenoghu](/wiki/Yeenoghu "Yeenoghu")                                                                                                                                                            | 93.1%          | 4.9%       | 2%           |
| **Demon princes** [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus"), [Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub "Baalzebub"), [Dispater](/wiki/Dispater "Dispater"), [Geryon](/wiki/Geryon "Geryon"), [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon"), [Orcus](/wiki/Orcus "Orcus") | 71.75%         | 23.75%     | 5%           |

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

[Bone devils](/wiki/Bone_devil "Bone devil") summon [skeletons](/wiki/Skeleton "Skeleton") instead of other demons, and can still be summoned by other demons.

### Summoning while polymorphed

If you are polymorphed into a major demon that can summon, each unarmed attack you perform on a monster has a 1⁄13 chance of summoning a [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame"), non-unique major demon to your side.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) As with hostile major demons, the demons that you summon will be of the same type as your current form 5⁄6 of the time, and will otherwise be a random demon of the same alignment.

## Strategy

The major demons are decently strong opponents, and an otherwise-prepared character entering the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead") and Gehennom proper should ensure they have a means of consistently dealing with them. The demon lords and princes in particular are all the more threatening to various degrees, which is compounded by their [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") behavior and the inability to [teleport](/wiki/Teleport "Teleport") on their levels.

If you are trying to summon [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon") (e.g. to fight for bragging rights) or else avoid him, Orcus is the most likely demon to summon him - the chances of Demogorgon being summoned per turn is 113 × 5100 = 1260 per turn. Your chance of having summoned Demogorgon after *n* turns is then:

| Number of turns *n* | Chance of [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon") |
| ------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- |
| 1                   | 0.38%                                                 |
| 50                  | 17.5%                                                 |
| 100                 | 32.0%                                                 |
| 200                 | 53.7%                                                 |
| 500                 | 85.4%                                                 |
| 1000                | 97.9%                                                 |

For those who do not wish to weather Orcus's spells and [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death"), the next most likely demon ruler to summon Demogorgon is Yeenoghu, though he is slower and cannot haste himself without a [wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster") or a [potion of speed](/wiki/Potion_of_speed "Potion of speed").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit d86b7e8e](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/d86b7e8e7c687a711912e8682894a3ef34c0c7f8), the presence of a demon lord or prince on a Gehennom level will block regular teleportation.

Orcus will not use his wand of death if he sees that you resist its effects.

## Messages

- \<The demon> appears in a cloud of smoke!

  A hostile demon was summoned by another hostile demon.

- Some hell-p has arrived!

  You summoned a tame demon while in the form of a demon.

## Variants

Some variants use `M2_DEMON` for demonic or devilish beings that exist outside of the demon monster class.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces the following major demons:

- & [spined devil](/wiki/Spined_devil "Spined devil")
- & [bearded devil](/wiki/Bearded_devil "Bearded devil")
- & [bar-lgura](/wiki/Bar-lgura "Bar-lgura")
- & [chasme](/wiki/Chasme "Chasme")
- & [babau](/wiki/Babau "Babau")
- & [nabassu](/wiki/Nabassu "Nabassu")
- Quest nemeses:
  - & [Maugneshaagar](/wiki/Maugneshaagar "Maugneshaagar")

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), a [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror_\(UnNetHack\) "Shambling horror (UnNetHack)") can be defined as a demon in certain games, allowing them to appear via demon gating and gate other demons themselves.

[Angels](/wiki/Angel "Angel") and demons attack each other on sight, as part of Nephi's grudge patch.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") define demons using the `MA_DEMON` flag, which applies to "minor" and major demons alike.

A character can summon demons and devils using the [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command") instead of the summoning occurring randomly during their melee attacks.

### SpliceHack

- *Main article: [Infernal (starting race)](/wiki/Infernal_\(starting_race\) "Infernal (starting race)")*

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the [infernal](/wiki/Infernal_\(starting_race\) "Infernal (starting race)") is a playable demonic race.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), demons are defined using the `MH_DEMON` flag.

Demon gating rules are changed from *NetHack*:

- Demon lords have a 4.9% chance of gating in another demon lord, and will otherwise gate in a regular demon - once the player has entered the third tier demon prince lair, demon lords have a 2% chance of gating in a demon prince.
- Demon princes (including [Lucifer](/wiki/Lucifer "Lucifer")) and the Wizard of Yendor have a 23.75% chance of gating in a demon lord, and will otherwise gate in one or two regular demons - once the player has entered the third tier demon prince lair, demon princes have a 5% chance of gating in another demon prince.
- Although Lucifer is a demon prince, he cannot be gated by any means, as he is meant to be encountered in the [Sanctum](/wiki/Sanctum "Sanctum").

[The Idol of Moloch](/wiki/The_Idol_of_Moloch "The Idol of Moloch") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [figurine](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine") of a horned devil and the [Infidel](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"): It can be applied like a normal figurine to summon a random major demon, including a horned devil, without using up the artifact. Unaligned Infidels that are [crowned](/wiki/Crowned "Crowned") will become demons themselves, with many of the same standard powers and weaknesses.

Major demon

'''Major demons''' are a type of [[monster]] that appear in ''[[NetHack]]''. These "true" demons are defined by the '''M2_DEMON''' flag, which is in turn used by other code such as the is_demon function. ==List of demons== The following monsters are considered demons: ===Lawful demons===
* {{monsymlink|horned devil}} * {{monsymlink|erinys}} * {{monsymlink|barbed devil}} * {{monsymlink|Geryon}} * {{monsymlink|Dispater}} * {{monsymlink|Baalzebub}} * {{monsymlink|Asmodeus}}
===Chaotic demons===
* {{monsymlink|water demon}} * {{monsymlink|succubus}} * {{monsymlink|incubus}} * {{monsymlink|marilith}} * {{monsymlink|vrock}} * {{monsymlink|hezrou}} * {{monsymlink|bone devil}} * {{monsymlink|ice devil}} * {{monsymlink|nalfeshnee}} * {{monsymlink|pit fiend}} * {{monsymlink|balrog}} * {{monsymlink|Juiblex}} * {{monsymlink|Yeenoghu}} * {{monsymlink|Orcus}} * {{monsymlink|Demogorgon}}
==Common traits== All demons are part of the [[Demon (monster class)|demon]] [[monster class]]. Demons and devils possess [[fire resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[drain resistance]], and [[death resistance]] (although they are still considered living creatures). They are vulnerable to [[silver]], and take an extra d20 damage when struck with a silver weapon. They also take an extra d4 damage from [[blessed]] weapons or bare-handed or martial attacks with [[blessed]] gloves. Non-[[unique]] demons and devils cannot be tamed unless the [[player]] character is one as well. [[Demon lords and princes]] are powerful unique monsters that inhabit Gehennom - a character will encounter some of their lairs while traversing Gehennom, and some others can only be encountered if they are summoned. ===Generation=== Major demons are always generated hostile, and are mostly found in [[Gehennom]] with the exception of [[quest nemeses]], though they can be summoned in the main dungeon through the various means described below: * [[Summon nasties]] can generate demons among the various hostile monsters that appear. * [[Polymorph trap]]s can create demons and other out of depth monsters, as can the [[wand of polymorph]] and [[potion of polymorph]] if you use them on other monsters. * Demons [[#Demon summoning|can be summoned]] as the [[minion]]s of [[Moloch]] or a [[chaotic]] god. * Demons generated by any of the above methods can also [[#Demons summoning demons|gate in other demons]] with their melee attacks, with the exception of foocubi and balrogs. Non-unique major demons that are generated at level creation have a {{frac|4|5}} chance of being created asleep unless you possess the [[Amulet of Yendor]], in which case they will always be awake.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1318|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} ===Demon summoning=== Hostile demons are generated if you anger Moloch or a chaotic deity, e.g. by converting or destroying their altars, or else by praying to a chaotic god with negative alignment. [[Sacrifice#Sacrificing creatures of own race|Sacrificing your own race]] can summon a major demon or a demon lord (but not a demon prince), as can [[anger]]ing a chaotic god when on an [[altar]] (by [[pray]]ing with negative alignment, converting a chaotic altar, or a few other actions). ===Demons summoning demons=== Major demons, demon lords and demon princes have a {{frac|13}} chance of summoning or "gating in" another demon each time that demon acts when adjacent to you (or your displaced image, in the case of [[displacement]]){{refsrc|src/mhitu.c|590|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} - major demons can summon other major demons and demon lords, while demon lords and princes can summon other demon rulers alongside major demons. Demon quest nemeses can summon other major demons, but cannot be summoned this way; foocubi and balrogs cannot summon demons, but can be gated in by other demons. Demon gating will always generate co-aligned demons, e.g. mariliths can gate in other chaotic demons and demon lords - as there are no lawful demon lords, lawful major demons will only summon other major demons, because there are no lawful demon lords. The [[Wizard of Yendor]] summoning nasties is an exception, as is any use of the spell in Gehennom (which is treated as though the Wizard cast it), and can create demons of any alignment.{{refsrc|src/minion.c|78|nethack=3.6.7}} The difference between major demons, demon lords, and demon princes lies in which other demons they can summon, and how often: all demons can summon other major demons, and are capable of summoning stronger demons as well. Major demons and demon lords have a {{frac|20}} chance of summoning a co-aligned demon lord, while demon lords have a {{frac|20}} chance of summoning another co-aligned demon lord, and a {{frac|50}} chance of summoning a demon prince. Demon princes and the Wizard of Yendor have a {{frac|20}} chance of summoning a co-aligned demon prince, and a {{frac|4}} chance of summoning a co-aligned demon lord if a prince is not summoned. Major demons that summon other major demons will choose their own type {{frac|5|6}} of the time, and otherwise choose a random type.{{refsrc|src/minion.c|89|nethack=3.6.7}} Demon lords and princes that summon a major demon have a {{frac|4}} chance of summoning two demons of that type.{{refsrc|src/minion.c|82|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/minion.c|87|nethack=3.6.7}} [[Demonbane]] completely blocks all forms of demon gating while wielded.{{refsrc|src/minion.c|62|nethack=3.6.7}} The following table shows the chance of a given demon gating in another demon of a specific rank: {| class="prettytable" ! rowspan=2| Summoner ! colspan=3| Summoned demon |- | Major demon | Demon lord | Demon prince |- | '''Major demons'''
(except [[Foocubus|foocubi]] and [[balrog]]s) | 95% | 5% | 0% |- | '''Demon lords'''
[[Juiblex]], [[Yeenoghu]] | 93.1% | 4.9% | 2% |- | '''Demon princes'''
[[Asmodeus]], [[Baalzebub]], [[Dispater]],
[[Geryon]], [[Demogorgon]], [[Orcus]] | 71.75% | 23.75% | 5% |} {{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|[[Bone devil]]s summon [[skeleton]]s instead of other demons, and can still be summoned by other demons.}} ===Summoning while polymorphed=== If you are polymorphed into a major demon that can summon, each unarmed attack you perform on a monster has a {{frac|13}} chance of summoning a [[tame]], non-unique major demon to your side.{{refsrc|src|uhitm.c|1483|nethack=3.6.7|comment=demonpet function}} As with hostile major demons, the demons that you summon will be of the same type as your current form {{frac|5|6}} of the time, and will otherwise be a random demon of the same alignment. ==Strategy== The major demons are decently strong opponents, and an otherwise-prepared character entering the [[Valley of the Dead]] and Gehennom proper should ensure they have a means of consistently dealing with them. The demon lords and princes in particular are all the more threatening to various degrees, which is compounded by their [[covetous]] behavior and the inability to [[teleport]] on their levels. If you are trying to summon [[Demogorgon]] (e.g. to fight for bragging rights) or else avoid him, Orcus is the most likely demon to summon him - the chances of Demogorgon being summoned per turn is {{sfrac|13}} × {{sfrac|5|100}} = {{sfrac|1|260}} per turn. Your chance of having summoned Demogorgon after ''n'' turns is then: {| class="prettytable" ! Number of turns ''n'' ! Chance of [[Demogorgon]] |- | 1 | 0.38% |- | 50 | 17.5% |- | 100 | 32.0% |- | 200 | 53.7% |- | 500 | 85.4% |- | 1000 | 97.9% |} For those who do not wish to weather Orcus's spells and [[wand of death]], the next most likely demon ruler to summon Demogorgon is Yeenoghu, though he is slower and cannot haste himself without a [[wand of speed monster]] or a [[potion of speed]]. {{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per {{commit|d86b7e8e7c687a711912e8682894a3ef34c0c7f8}}, the presence of a demon lord or prince on a Gehennom level will block regular teleportation. Orcus will not use his wand of death if he sees that you resist its effects.}} ==Messages== {{message| appears in a cloud of smoke!|A hostile demon was summoned by another hostile demon.}} {{message|Some hell-p has arrived!|You summoned a tame demon while in the form of a demon.}} ==Variants== Some variants use '''M2_DEMON''' for demonic or devilish beings that exist outside of the demon monster class. ===SLASH'EM=== [[SLASH'EM]] introduces the following major demons: * {{monsymlink|spined devil}} * {{monsymlink|bearded devil}} * {{monsymlink|bar-lgura}} * {{monsymlink|chasme}} * {{monsymlink|babau}} * {{monsymlink|nabassu}} * Quest nemeses: ** {{monsymlink|Maugneshaagar}} ===UnNetHack=== In [[UnNetHack]], a [[Shambling horror (UnNetHack)|shambling horror]] can be defined as a demon in certain games, allowing them to appear via demon gating and gate other demons themselves. [[Angel]]s and demons attack each other on sight, as part of Nephi's grudge patch. ===dNetHack=== [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]] define demons using the '''MA_DEMON''' flag, which applies to "minor" and major demons alike. A character can summon demons and devils using the [[Monster (command)|#monster]] [[extended command]] instead of the summoning occurring randomly during their melee attacks. ===SpliceHack=== {{main|Infernal (starting race)}} In [[SpliceHack]], the [[Infernal (starting race)|infernal]] is a playable demonic race. ===EvilHack=== In [[EvilHack]], demons are defined using the '''MH_DEMON''' flag. Demon gating rules are changed from ''NetHack'': * Demon lords have a 4.9% chance of gating in another demon lord, and will otherwise gate in a regular demon - once the player has entered the third tier demon prince lair, demon lords have a 2% chance of gating in a demon prince. * Demon princes (including [[Lucifer]]) and the Wizard of Yendor have a 23.75% chance of gating in a demon lord, and will otherwise gate in one or two regular demons - once the player has entered the third tier demon prince lair, demon princes have a 5% chance of gating in another demon prince. * Although Lucifer is a demon prince, he cannot be gated by any means, as he is meant to be encountered in the [[Sanctum]]. [[The Idol of Moloch]] is an [[artifact]] [[figurine]] of a horned devil and the [[Infidel]] [[quest artifact]]: It can be applied like a normal figurine to summon a random major demon, including a horned devil, without using up the artifact. Unaligned Infidels that are [[crowned]] will become demons themselves, with many of the same standard powers and weaknesses. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Monsters]]
